Reviews.Title: “Practical & Best for Orchard Road shoppers”
Reviews.Author: Maiel
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze. Prompt and matter of fact discussion with front desk personnel. Barely 10 minutes with our transaction. Location was perfect, especially if your objective is to shop, shop, shop! Hotel was near a small hawker center, near a Gong Cha outlet (which I love!) and near just about all the malls you want - Orchard Central, etc. Room is basic, we booked a standard but was upgraded to Superior. Our room had a window and the bathroom was quite spacious based on Singapore standards. Still very basic but with the rate we paid, was value for money. The bed was okay, though the sheets could be better. There was a safe in the room and a closet for our things. We were provided bottled water daily. We did not have breakfast with our booking so I cannot rate the meals in this facility. TV channels were just 4. Local channels with 1 channel in English. Do not expect cable here. There was free wifi in our room and at the lobby. This is quite an old hotel but will do if my only objective is to shop my heart out and be out most of the day. It was a practical choice and safe for travellers.

Reviews.Title: “5 star location and convenience, but at 2 star prices!”
Reviews.Author: live÷e
Reviews.Content: One will enjoy their stay if come here with an open mind. Value for money - No frills is the key here! It is right smack in the bustling Orchard Road area. Yes, there's food, restaurants EVERYWHERE, you will be surrounded by great malls as you step out from the hotel. Super convenient to the nearest subway station too - Somerset Station. Convenient city bus-stop just in front of Concorde Hotel, which is just 3 minutes walk away. My room was super spacious and overlook the beautiful Palace Park, and also the busy highway. For the noise sensitive, it is good to request for a room that overlook the other side, facing Concorde Hotel I believe. My room was clean overall, my safe box didn't work but that didn't bother me as I had my stuff with me all the time and stayed for 2 nights only. Breakfast provided at the lobby level was simple and basic, but will get you through the morning. Indulge in Singapore's great array of food offerings should be part of your adventure, and not the breakfast at Supreme :)

Reviews.Title: “Worst ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Ppaann
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty small and hard to find ... But the worst of it is the service . When I ask whether they could call us a taxi ... The staff said you can go out and wave for one by yourself !!?? When I complained that there was a shouting sound last night at 2-4 a.m. And we couldn't sleep , the staff said that you should came down complain immediately not now ...with very unpleasant sound.... So I should go down at 2 am to complain ?? While we are sleeping ... At 8:30 am the housekeeping use the key to come into ur room to clean the room but at least when she saw out she just closed the door !!?? And I do warn that there's no bellboy .... You have to carry everything by urself .... No helping !!! And the TV have no remote control too . And be prepare for dealing with the mood of the staff ....

Reviews.Title: “convenient but lift rather small”
Reviews.Author: Teresa967
Reviews.Content: Its location is good, 3 mins' walk to Orchard Road. You can find food anywhere. However, the lift is rather small. Big family like ours, we had to divide into 2 groups :)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Orchard Rd”
Reviews.Author: Anne B
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and comfortable and very close to orchard road - just walk around the corner. The managers were very helpful and you can leave your luggage there and collect it in the afternoon when checking out. We left our luggage while we went to the zoo - they have chains to lock it up.

Reviews.Title: “Fit for someone on the go!”
Reviews.Author: babblingtraveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently placed just behind Orchard Road and even at night is very safe when you go back from your intense shopping. If you are a lone traveller and you enjoy mostly shopping and wandering around Singapore then Hotel Supreme is the place for you. A big plus for the personnel who were very helpful when it comes to transportation and tips on taking cabs going to the airport. There is wifi but is prepaid. The room is just right for your comfort going to rest or sleep but they can improve more on the walls or the lights.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lily K
Reviews.Content: This is really a nice hotel with very friendly staff. I love to stay this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “well hidden hotel at the fringe of orchard road”
Reviews.Author: edkhor
Reviews.Content: you wouldnt be able to find this hotel becos its tucked well hidden at cavenagh road ... but its a great place to stay with clean rooms & friendly hotel staff. breakfast is simple but the cheapest so far at sgd7 ... but if you prefer bigger portions you can always walk out to orchard to eat ... no swimming pool and other facilities ... just a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Visafly
Reviews.Content: very nice place! near the Orchard road, 10 minutes to subway, easy to get everywhere, nice supermarkets and trade centers with lots of restaurants.!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Stay”
Reviews.Author: JerryW6
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Supreme was located in a good area, within walking distance, 1 block away, to Orchard road. **The entire staff was very friendly during our stay. **Hotel was clean, rooms were clean, **It seemed we had to wait 10 to 20 minutes for extra towels when we asked, **Elevator is very small, only 4 people can fit in side, but that's not a big issue. **Breakfast was joke, only toast, jam, butter, noodles, coffee, juice, crackers. That's free with the room, if you have extra people expect to pay 8.00 for adults, and 4.00 for kids, that's Singapore Dollars. **The AC will keep the room cool at night, but in the morning it seems to be catching up, never really cooling the room well enough for me. Guess I am use to the AC's in American Hotels. **Bathroom was nice size, shower had a little mold in the grout lines, not a problem, but a turn off. **Room-was a deluxe with two beds, but the beds were smaller then a full size bed. Two adults can sleep in them, but for me it was not comfortable with 2 people. Over all the stay was good, the Hotel was good, the Hotel was Average for an Asian Hotel. I would stay there again for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Did not expect!”
Reviews.Author: Mujammami
Reviews.Content: I spent 8 nights in Singapore. As you know its unbelievable place but also, you need a nice place to sleep or get some rest t least. I didn't expect that Superem Hotel is serving that poor serveices in such a nice place (near Orchard Rd.). The safety box is not available at your room, the furnatures were very old, TV channels is not clear and not good. The staff had a bad communication skills. Just the price is better comparing with the other hotels in that place. My advice to look to another place other than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget stay”
Reviews.Author: pinkylurves
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Supreme Hotel for 3 days 2 nights and I've paid for SGD150/night. Actually it's my second time staying at Supreme Hotel. The main reason I choose Supreme Hotel is because of its location and the hotel do provide free parking facilities. Staff: They are not friendly. They do not smile/greet you. House keeper are noisy IN THE EARLY MORNING. I did not have good sleep due to the noise, which is kinda turn-off! Room: Clean but old. I dare not to use the water boiler as it has black/brown-ish stain on it. Probably, it's time to change the water boiler. The bed was hard and the blanket was too thin. Do not stay here if you want/expect good service/luxury rooms etc. The ONLY thing that I like is: the LOCATION of the hotel! Orchard road is just next street! MRT somerset station is just 3 minutes walk! :) Besides that, you don't have to worry about food. There's a food court at the opposite building and at night, there's a row of stall selling food (seafood, asian food) till late night. It's definitely worth the SGD150/per room that I paid for!

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping on the road side”
Reviews.Author: SUPER_LUCAN
Reviews.Content: We selected Hotel Supreme for transit on our way to Indonesia. The hotel is located in the perimeter of Orchard Road, close to MRT stations and eateries. The amenities of the hotel is quite standard, nothing is special, however it is clean and neat. The staffs are friendly and very helpful in providing you information. These are the value of this hotel. We got a room with the window facing the garden of the Presidential Palace - a privilege, but the window is not sound proof - we were disturbed by the traffic between the hotel and the Presidential Palace until late and starts again early morning. Breakfast was a bit strange for us - the hotel serves very soft bread and jam, and instant noodle in cups (Asians do eat noodle, but we do not enjoy instant noodle...). Tha fares we paid did not match to what we got. It is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Best and Affordable hotel for a Family of 5”
Reviews.Author: friggincool
Reviews.Content: We thought that finding an affordable hotel around Orchard Road that could accommodate 5 people into a single family room that is near everything that we need (strategically located in between two MRT stations, how good is that?!) for only 4 days of stay would be impossible! But thanks to this site for the reviews and the friendly staff of the hotel (when I contacted them through email which I found on their website), the experience was as wonderful as we expected it to be! The hotel generally only is suited for people who needs a place to rest after a long day of sightseeing and having fun. It is not for people who wanted who wanted the VIP treatment. The service was practically good because the place always looked clean and the staff is very friendly. But on the down side, the bathroom is a bit small, the elevator is really smaller that can only accommodate 2-3 medium built people and if you want to have an emergency call abroad or want an internet connection you need to pay extra charge [ SG $5 per hour for the internet that's a bit expensive]. And the hotel offers a no-breakfast scheme, but anyway it was rather a good thing for us considering that the hotel itself is actually situated at the heart of Orchard Road that houses tons of restaurants (from Asian to European) and commercial buildings of mostly high end fashion (Louis Vuitton, Chanel - name it they have it there). The hotel is also near the Singapore's Visitor's Center (walking distance of three blocks away) if you want additional information about the country, the transportation (better ask about the Visitor's Pass) and the places to go to in general. Also if you want to go to the nearest supermarket, you'll easily see Centrepoint Shopping Center (beside the hotel facing Orchard Rd) and if you want to experience eating traditional Chinese and other Asian cuisine at a cheap price you can find it an open area at the back of the hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tiwichan
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 days 1 night in Supreme Hotel. On the first day we arrived earlier from the airport, around 11 am. We planned to put the luggage and wander around Orchard area until the check-in time. Apparently we can already check-in at that time without additional fee since our room is ready. A very nice service. The room is more spacious than I imagined. Once I stayed on a budget hotel in Singapore, they only have a tiny room, even without window. but this one is much much better. This hotel is located near Dhoby Ghaut MRT and Orchard area, especially Plaza Singapura. A great thing for shoppers.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location,Clean decent sized rooms,value for money”
Reviews.Author: MJMR42
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent in terms of location- 2 minutes walk to Orchard Road, 5mt. walk to Dhoby Ghaut MRT (one of the biggest stations in terms of lines) and taxis and buses easy to come by. Staff are courteous and helpful, the rooms are decent sized (we had a family room) and clean, same went for the bathroom and linen. Plenty of eateries around- Hawker centres, shopping mall foodcourts and restaurants. Shopping @ Orchard Road is so convenient! Accomodated our late check out as our flight was in the evening.Will definitely recommendthis hotel! Wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Efficient and Professional”
Reviews.Author: AC-Angel
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Very professional and efficient staff 2. Clean rooms 3. Good Location Cons: 1. Old building 2. Bad lighting 3. Small rooms and elevators If you're looking for a budget hotel near Singapore's shopping district where you can just leave your shopping bags Hotel Supreme is the place!

Reviews.Title: “good budget hotel in d vicinity of orchard rd”
Reviews.Author: leezkl
Reviews.Content: recommended for young travellers who dont prefer to stay at hostel or dorm type.the hotel provide basic necessity like kettle, small fridge,hot shower, towel n soap. clean carpet,toilet n bedsheet. near concorde shopping mall.muslim restaurant are available around like mawarddah,ali ming n nasi padang

Reviews.Title: “OMG- This is not a hotel. Supreme is a place for loot.”
Reviews.Author: dprsvb
Reviews.Content: Following is my mail to the management of Hotel Supreme. It will suffice what i want to say about them Yours is the lousiest hotel i ever landed up with. I stayed in your hotel's room number 206 from 27-11-2010 to 28-11-2010. What a sick experience it was. I found the room unclean, bedsheets stained, bathroom door without a bolt and A/C window see through. The food was worst ever i had in my life. YOu can ask your serving boys. The Dosai was like raw rice paste and sambhar like gutter water. The previous night dinner was such a horror but i thought to try again before making an opinion.But the breakfast confirmed that you are not a hotel but a place for loot. For Rs.1600 a night you are simply thieves. I am going to spread the word all over the internet so that no more people fall victim to your photographs displayed on your site.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: flashjack92
Reviews.Content: We booked on line for a Studio room, this has a double bed, got a room with 2 single beds. Tea/coffee facilities but they wouldn't supply us with milk and sugar, told us to buy our own. Their web page shows a cafeteria and they even speak of having breakfast before you go out for the day, guess what-no cafeteria. And the photo with the girl in the hammock between the two palm trees near the beach indicated to us that the hotel was near the water-think again. We were quoted $135.94 per night but were charged on leaving the hotel $160.00. Reception didn't want to help in any way whatsoever and the manager likewise. would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good budgeted hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hami80
Reviews.Content: I stayed one nigt at hotel supreme. I took a taxi from the airport which costed 12 S$. Its a budgeted hotel, do not expect service. The cost of the room was S$ 180. The location of the hotel is excellent. Its on orchard road. In case you want to take city tour, the office is just behind hotel supreme. There are good bars around the corner. Even the MRt is just 5 mins walk from hotel Supreme. We went to jurang bir park and night safari on the first day. The MRT is very well organized in Singapore. Its an experience to travel in the MRT. If you are going for a short stay, advice to take take taxi, there is not much of cost difference as singapore is a small country. The next day in the morning we took the city tour. The room and bathroom is clean, we planned to be out of the hotel most of the time hence having a luxurious hotel is not worth it. There is no breakfast in the hotel. The receptionist was good and helpful. I dont mind staying again in singapore in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but bad rooms and sevices.”
Reviews.Author: cantique
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrible, the receptionist was not friendly and the room was really ugly and dirty. I found garbages under the bed! Wow, unbelievably not comfortable though it is really cloe to Orchard Road. I will not come back there again. Ever.

Reviews.Title: “OK sized room, horrible beds, great location”
Reviews.Author: BruceMichael98
Reviews.Content: We booked a family room for 1 night in October 2010. Great location at one end of main shopping strip of Orchard Road. Room potentially OK with two double beds (not queen) but beds were appalling with sags and slopes and almost impossible to get comfortable. No late checkout was allowed and internet cost $5 per hour. Soap from dispenser in bath and sink. Room was clean and service was OK. Was cheap booked through Agoda.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate location, bad service”
Reviews.Author: KevinKNL
Reviews.Content: I went to Singapore for a three-day trip in late July and it seemed that this was one of the best hotels available (according to TripAdvisor), so I gave it a shot. The hotel is located in the heart of the City of Singapore and from the airport, it's approx. 20 minutes by taxi (= 10 euro). It's location is truly optimal, because you only have to walk for several minutes to Orchard Road (the main shopping district). For the other locations in Singapore a taxi is probably a better solution. As for the hotel itself, me and my parents had chosen the Supreme room (a king-size bed and one normal bed). We actually got a cheap room with two normal beds and a cot. This was very disappointing, especially because of the price we paid. The service was pretty straight forward, but they weren't friendly at all. They just wanted us to pay and get out. The rooms were clean and basic. If you don't demand a lot (just a place to stay), this hotel is good, but overpriced. If you last-minute book a trip to Singapore, this hotel isn't too bad. But for the price, you could easily get a better one.

Reviews.Title: “Horrid experience”
Reviews.Author: P5EUN
Reviews.Content: I didnot like this hotel one bit. It was horrid and dated. The staff are not friendly and it felt like I was only a conveyor belt and they wanted me to pay and leave. The only thing going for this place is its prime location ( it is only 2 minutes from Orchard road) I will not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious for family of four”
Reviews.Author: Ready2travelagain
Reviews.Content: The room had two king sized beds which comfortably accommodated two adults and two daughters 13 & 11. We had ample space for our four large bags at the end of the beds with plenty of space to walk past. There was a small sitting room and an ensuite bathroom. The facilities are dated, but clean and functional. The airconditioning worked well. It is a noisy location at night time as the hotel is near an expressway but we were tired so slept soundly. We paid SG160 per night which was outstanding value. Located close to Orchard Road and the bus stop to the Zoo and Night Safari.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Spore07
Reviews.Content: The staffs are responsive to our needs. Even when we asked their help thru phone (we're outside the hotel). The hotel is not too far from Orchard Road and located in the middle of Dhobby Gaut (correct spell ?) and Sommerset MRT stop also you can jump in to the bus using concorde hotel bus stop (on the Orchard Road).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent staffs and spacious room!”
Reviews.Author: Reginalmz
Reviews.Content: I booked the superior twin-bedded room for my parents though agoda.com. Location: There is nothing much to say about the location as it is very near to mrt, shopping centers and eating places.. Room: Clean, spacious, bright, toilet is spacious and clean too... Money: Definitely worth it as compared to other hotels nearby... Staff: Excellet! Friendly and great help! Be it the receptionist, the man who help to carry luggage, an uncle helping to open the carpark gates or the auntie cleaning the rooms... Carpark: It's free and because it's a private carpark, the gate in and out is closed all the time. So if you want to park your car or coming out, have to ask the hotel staff to open it. Though it's a bit troublesome, but it's safe and free! so who cares?? =) Lift: There are 2 lifts...A bit small but can squeeze about 5 ppl... Lobby: Enough seats to sit while waiting to check in and out... Overall: Value for money!!

Reviews.Title: “worth value and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: milka_yk
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there for 3 nights and the hotel was beyond my expectation. I got a best deal by booking on line, it was cheaper than other hotels near Orchard area. The room was spacious, clean, quiet and comfy. I was sick when I went to Sgpore but I got better since I had enough rest. Though they didn't serve breakfast but there are many hawker food centers nearby. The two MRT stations (Somerset & Dhoby Ghaut) were just 5 minutes walking. The location was excellent! I will definetely go back to this hotel for sure :)

Reviews.Title: “Spartan -”
Reviews.Content: No Frills. Location is OK, Small hotel with limited facilities - no business center, no restaurant. My solo room faced next door building. Clean room but old furnishings with dim lighting. About 4-5 TV Channels. Some roadside noise at night. Staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore stopover”
Reviews.Author: Paguirigan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is cheap, it is quite old and spooky. The room we got was on the fourth floor and it was in front of a small counter that looks like a hospital nurse station. :) Don't expect too much as the facilities are poor. The linen were old but clean. The room is wide enough. The location is quiet but getting a taxi in front of the hotel is difficult, though Orchard road is just a block away and getting to places from there is not a problem. For a quick stop over with small baggage, this place is good for it's price. Booking online saves a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Supreme is value for money”
Reviews.Author: kalipay
Reviews.Content: It's value for money, why? The location is perfect, right within the Orchard area, walking distance to the shops, major train and bus stations. Though the rooms are not as brightly lit, they have wide windows (especially if you're lucky to get a room facing Kramat Lane). Staff are okey, especially the Filipina at the Front Desk named Menchu. The bathroom is clean, and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap value hotel”
Reviews.Author: krkchn
Reviews.Content: It's very cheap. It is just 220 SD when booking online, with 2 queen sized beds and one single bed. Don't expect anything as the facilities are poor as what you would expect for the price. What you get is just the basics and nothing fancy. Clean bed, clean room, clean comfort room. And that's it

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: et80
Reviews.Content: Very good price for a central location. Room was basic but clean, cool, dark and quiet! It was also very large with a huge window. There was a fridge and kettle so was possible to have a simple breakfast in the room. Staff were polite and helpful. If you are looking for luxury you won't find it here, but if you want good value I thoroughly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Dont expect luxury, but expect a great location to MRT and Orchard Rd”
Reviews.Author: qnw
Reviews.Content: If you are after a luxury hotel in Singapore, this is not one so expect what you pay for. I have marked this as above average for the price you pay and where it is located in Singapore. I stayed here with my family (five with three kids under ten) for five nights. The family room is good and spacious although we did have a roll away with two double beds. It is hard to locate one room for five people in Singapore so this suited us well as we were out all day sightseeing anyway. The room was plenty big enough to take all our luggage and for the kids to spread things around. It was clean, had all the things we needed and is well located to both Orchard Road and Dhoby Ghaut MRT. In addition, there is a great mini hawker market at the around the corner at the back and a foodcourt. As expected for the price, there is no real breakfast or meals, but who cares; Singapore is known for its food, so it is an opportunity to get out and try something local. There are some really cheap hotels in some really 'interesting' places in Singapore. This is not one of them. This is in a great spot that is safe for families and if you are just there for a short stay more than satisfactory but realise that it is a basic hotel and that is why you are paying less. We were on the second (third?) floor family room that faced Kramat Road. Road noise was reasonably loud, but if this bothers you, bring some ear plugs. I've also previously stayed in a room at the rear of the hotel and this was quiet, but dark (faced a wall).

Reviews.Title: “Supremely Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: g-child
Reviews.Content: My family and I just arrived from our five day trip to Singapore and stayed at the hotel supreme near orchard road..i was really satisfied on how courteous the people from the front desk were..We arrived at around 11:30am and were allowed to have an early check in.They gave us the rm.301 w/c was a family room because there were 4 of us all adults..the room was big and clean even the bathroom was well maintained..The location was perfect just a 5min walk to orchard road and a 10min walk to the nearest mrt station..also a 5min walk to a near hawker centre for cheap food...overall I would recommend this hotel to people who want to stay in a hotel in Singapore with a budget not compromising quality..

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: BobJoe2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Hotel Supreme in Singapore. It was much better than what we expected after we saw the bad reviews on this site. We stayed at a family room on the 3rd floor. Room was large and spacious, beds were comfy and was good value for 250 singapore dollars. Have to disagree with other reviews that said that the aircon was noisy and that the room was dirty. The place was cleaner than the grand central hotel, which we stayed in during the last time we went to singapore. After a long day of going around singapore, we always looked forward to relaxing here. Highly recommended for anyone who wants a hotel near orchard road.

Reviews.Title: “Below average”
Reviews.Author: KiwisFromWelly
Reviews.Content: The travel agent jacked this one up for my wife and daugter for a stop over. Noisy location and air-con, worn-out decor and mold on the windows. Wouldn't use again or recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel i have ever seen”
Reviews.Author: mlc11
Reviews.Content: I had to book this hotel in February as all the other hotels were fully booked due to Air Show in Singapore in February. I booked for 6 nights but had to cut short my stay there and shift to another hotel after two days, due to non-existant facilities in this hotel. Room was horrible and very bad furniture and dirty bedsheets. Non functional TV and cracked walls and ceiling with seepage marks on them. The service and also the behaviour of the hotel staff was very rude and not upto the mark. I will recommend that nobody should stay there. At least I will never stay there in my life during my visits to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “basic and noisy”
Reviews.Author: masuk
Reviews.Content: We chose the Supreme after rejecting the Hotel 81 group and let our travel agent make the booking. It is nicely situated near Orchard road, close to a lot of hawkers meals at $3.00 each, close to the huge MRT Dhobi Gaut station, but wow, is it noisy! Right next to a tunnel outlet, and 6 lanes of continuous traffic , all day, all night. The windows are not double-glazed, as are other hotels nearby; other guests asked to move to another room, but we liked the view of the istana gardens; internet at another hotel. Reception desk were most helpful with directions. Breakfast was a laugh compared to our hotel in KL. 2 slices of toast and coffee for $3.00. Take your own soap, as whatever is in the bathroom liquid soap containers is revolting!

Reviews.Title: “A supreme nightmare”
Reviews.Author: ggpl
Reviews.Content: This is the worst accommodation we've ever experienced. I have to precise that my husband and I lived in pretty remote countries (Siberia, west & central Africa, ...) and sincerely if we had arrived earlier in the evening we would have left for another hotel. We were in the very very small room 406 that included: - One small double bed - Synthetic bedsheets with cigarette's burns and greasy spots (obviously not clean) - A ridiculous thin blanket - Only one side table and one side lamp - A very basic and depressing neon light ambiance - A great view on a very close wall - 2 tiny, old, ripped towels - No remote control for the TV - the air conditioning had 2 modes : freezing cold or hot and humid But all of this could be ok even for a so called 3 stars hotel, if the walls are not that thin that not only you can hear all your neighbors but also smoke their cigarettes.... I went back to the reception to change for a non smoking room and the weird, rude, "not willing to help" staff told me that in fact that was a non-smoking room !!! seriously ! We literally spent the night in an ashtray. And even for ex-smokers like us it was very difficult to sleep in this stinky room. To summarize: - the staff lobby staff is incompetent and rude. They just care about you paying cash or by credit card... - the room was small, depressing, uncomfortable, dark and so so stinky - the location could have been fine if only the hotel was not that close to a very busy express way It's far from being a 3 stars hotel and the only reason you have to stay there is if you need a chock therapy to quit smoking. Gaelle

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: CnDeu
Reviews.Content: I planned an extended trip through SE Asia where Singapore was the gateway. It's an expensive city, so I chose this hotel. The hotel is okay, nothing great. And the room was very basic, clean, and reasonably comfortable ... you get what you pay for. The location was perfect, though - around the corner from Orchard Road. Orchard Road offers lots of places to eat, shop, and catch public transport. For travellers on a budget, this is a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Obnoxiously bad service. This hotel is a RIP OFF.”
Reviews.Author: airelon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is run by a very extremely unreasonable and absolutely rude owner Lawrence Ang Poh Sew. My car was merely parked for a few minutes in their compound which I did so so I could ask the staff about their hotel rates. Before I asked about the rates from the staff, I used a nearby public toilet, I felt it was rude just to walk in and use the hotel's toilet. I returned to speak to the staff at the hotel counter, got the rates information and returned to my car and found it was clamped. Despite my bad that I should have seek permission for parking, I explained my case to the owner Lawrence Ang Poh Sew politely. However he roguishly threatened to call the police when I polite spoke and hope to gain his understanding. He charged $100 from me for unclamping my car. My car had only parked for less than 15min. Throughout this whole ordeal, I was made to feel they wish to profit from any possible way in this situation. I will feel unsafe staying in a hotel which harbor such unethical uncompassionate thoughts.

Reviews.Title: “A notch above YMCA hostel”
Reviews.Author: ButteredRolls
Reviews.Content: Stay here three nights due to last minute changes in my travel plans. The room is super basic, like everyone has mentioned -- simple double beds, basic shower, small room, minimal service. It is almost similar to a dorm room or a youth hostel in Europe. If you come in expecting basic accommodation, you will be fine. If you expect Holiday Inn, you will be disappointed. Basically, it is a clean place to rest your head at the end of the day. Nonetheless, the location can't be beat. It's right behind Orchard Road and close to everything that is important in Singapore - shopping, hawker stores, MRT, buses, tourism, etc. And at S$140/night (US$100), it is a bargain. Singapore is a VERY expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “supremely bad!”
Reviews.Author: traveller317853
Reviews.Content: The Supreme hotel is extremely basic and run down. Booked a triple room and recieved a room with two single beds and a camp bed. The sheets were ripped in several places and the bathroom was very run down. The shower curtain was rotten and towels provided also ripped. The hotel is located right beside an express way and it was very noisy all the time... even with the window closed and curtains drawn. As we arrived prior to book in time we asked staff if we could leave bags, the staff directed us to leave our bags out in the foyer and locked toegther with a length of chain with their lock and key... which they refused to give us. As we had brought our own locks with us we locked our bags... so if you are to be in the same position i suggest you come prepared. There were no breakfast facilities available so you will also need to be prepared to find a spot to pick up some breakfast. Overall the hotel is located close to orchard road but even closer to a very noisy express way and for the price charged for the room... very below standard! I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Supreme about this place”
Reviews.Author: banjo1235
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October 2005 for two days. Room was dark, old, shabby, smelly. In fact, after we arrived home we had to launder all of our clothes (even the ones that remained in our suitcases during our stay) as the smell from the room had permeated everything! Rollaway bed had no top sheet - reception informed me that no sheet was available. Unable to get extra towels. Corners have been cut everywhere - no power points in bathroom. Reception staff were friendly, but limited in their ability to provide any real service. Hotel is in a decent location, but I would not consider staying here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Supreme
HotelInfo.Address: 15 Kramat Road | Orchard Road, Singapore 228750, Singapore
